1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 
3 import rospy
4 
5 # Communication imports
6 import select
7 import socket
8 
9 from .communication_functions import create_socket_server, receive_dict, dict_to_packet
10 from .command_interpreter import CommandInterpreter
11 
12 # Threading
13 from threading import Thread, Lock
14 import queue
15 
16 
17 class TcpServer:
18 
19  def __init__(self, ip_address='', port=40001, on_client_connection_cb=None, on_client_disconnection_cb=None):
20  # Server TCP
21  self.__ip_address = ip_address
22  self.__port = port
23 
24  try:
25  self.__server = create_socket_server(ip_address='', port=self.__port)
26  self.__server.listen(1)
27  self.__client = None
28  self.__is_client_connected = False
29  self.__on_client_connection_cb = on_client_connection_cb
30  self.__on_client_disconnection_cb = on_client_disconnection_cb
31 
32  # Thread
33  self.__loop_thread = Thread(target=self.__loop, name="TCP Server Loop thread")
34  self.__command_executor_thread = Thread(target=self.__command_executor_loop,
35  name="TCP Server Command Executor thread")
36  self.__is_running = True
37  self.__is_busy_lock = Lock()
38  # Interpreter
39  self.__interpreter = CommandInterpreter()
40  self.__queue = queue.Queue(1)
41 
42  except socket.error as err:
43  rospy.logerr("UserInterface.init : TCP server unable to start : %s", err)
44  self.__server = None
45 
46  def __del__(self):
47  self.quit()
48 
49  def start(self):
50  if self.__server is not None:
51  self.__loop_thread.start()
52  self.__command_executor_thread.start()
53  return self
54  else:
55  return None
56 
57  def quit(self):
58  self.__is_running = False
59  if self.__loop_thread.is_alive():
60  self.__loop_thread.join()
61  if self.__command_executor_thread.is_alive():
62  self.__command_executor_thread.join()
63  if self.__client is not None:
64  self.__shutdown_client()
65  if self.__server is not None:
66  self.__server.close()
67 
68  def __loop(self):
69  rospy.loginfo("TCP Server - Started on port {}".format(self.__port))
70  inputs = [self.__server]
71  while self.__is_running is True:
72  readable, writable, exceptional = select.select(inputs, [], [], 0.5)
73  for s in readable:
74  if self.__is_client_connected is False and s is self.__server:
75  self.__accept_client()
76  inputs.append(self.__client)
77  elif s is not self.__server:
78  self.__client_socket_event(inputs)
79 
80  # -- CLIENTS
81 
82  def __accept_client(self):
83  self.__client, address = self.__server.accept()
84  self.__is_client_connected = True
85  rospy.loginfo("TCP Server - Client connected from IP address: {}/{}".format(address[0], address[1]))
86  if self.__on_client_connection_cb is not None:
87  self.__on_client_connection_cb()
88 
89  def __client_socket_event(self, inputs):
90  dict_command_received = self.__read_command()
91  if dict_command_received is not None:
92  with self.__is_busy_lock:
93  self.__queue.put(dict_command_received)
94  else:
95  rospy.loginfo("TCP Server - Client disconnect")
96  self.__is_client_connected = False
97  self.__shutdown_client()
98  inputs.remove(self.__client)
99  if self.__on_client_disconnection_cb is not None:
100  self.__on_client_disconnection_cb()
101 
102  def __shutdown_client(self):
103  if self.__client is not None:
104  try:
105  self.__client.shutdown(socket.SHUT_RDWR)
106  except socket.error:
107  pass
108  self.__client.close()
109 
110  # -- COMMANDS
111  # LOOP which execute commands in queue
112  def __command_executor_loop(self):
113  while self.__is_running is True:
114  try:
115  dict_command_received = self.__queue.get(block=True, timeout=0.5)
116  with self.__is_busy_lock:
117  self.__treat_command(dict_command_received)
118  except queue.Empty:
119  pass
120 
121  def __read_command(self):
122  try:
123  received_dict = receive_dict(sckt=self.__client)
124  except (socket.error, ValueError) as e:
125  rospy.loginfo("TCP Server - Error while receiving answer: {}".format(e))
126  return None
127  if not received_dict:
128  return None
129  return received_dict
130 
131  def __treat_command(self, dict_command_received):
132  try:
133  result_data = self.__interpreter.interpret_command(dict_command_received)
134  except Exception as e:
135  rospy.logerr("tcp server - {}".format(e), exc_info=True)
136  command_name = dict_command_received["command"]
137  self.__answer_error(command_name, e)
138  else:
139  self.__send(result_data)
140 
141  # -- ANSWER AND SEND
142 
143  def __answer_error(self, command_name, error):
144  str_err = "An error occured while executing the last command : {}".format(error)
145  dict_error = self.__interpreter.generate_dict_failure(command_name, str_err)
146  packet_error = dict_to_packet(dict_error)
147  self.__send(packet_error)
148 
149  def __send(self, result_data: bytes):
150  if self.__client is not None:
151  try:
152  self.__client.sendall(result_data)
153  except socket.error as e:
154  rospy.loginfo("TCP Server - Error while sending answer to client: {}".format(e))
